definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: The relability of information is the life line of future successful information war.
sentences.chinese: 信息的可信度是未来遂行信息化作战的生命线。

sentences.english: That can jeopardize organizational reputations and undermine the credibility of their information.
sentences.chinese: 那就有可能会损害组织的声誉并削弱信息的可信度。

sentences.english: You will lose credibility among your friends and colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 你会在你朋友和同事之中失去可信度。

sentences.english: Quoting research such as this report on scrolling can increase your credibility.
sentences.chinese: 引用一个研究结果能够增加你的内容的可信度。

sentences.english: That would further undermine the credibility of the election.
sentences.chinese: 那将会进一步破坏选举的可信度。

sentences.english: This system relies on users ability to trust the authenticity of the certifiers ' public keys.
sentences.chinese: 此种系统依赖于用户信任证明人公开密钥的可信度。

sentences.english: The Trusted Measurement Mechanism is the core and basis of Trusted Computing.
sentences.chinese: 可信度量机制是可信计算技术的核心与关键。

sentences.english: This gives you the accountability and motivation needed.
sentences.chinese: 这能给予你可信度和所需要的动力。

sentences.english: The production of this catalogue is in suspicion of the believability of print and media.
sentences.chinese: 这次画册的制作是对印刷和传媒的可信度的质疑。

sentences.english: and it gives it some credibility and it gives it some public appeal.
sentences.chinese: 这就增加了这个慈善机构的可信度和对公众的吸引力。

sentences.english: The outcome only added weight to the superstition.
sentences.chinese: 这个结果只是增加了这个迷信的可信度。

sentences.english: Those estimates now seem in danger of being outdated.
sentences.chinese: 这些估计现在似乎已经没有可信度了。

sentences.english: Insiders say "water army" are seriously affecting the credibility of the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 内部人员说“水军”严重影响到互联网的可信度。

sentences.english: They have zero credibility, a zero track record on truthfulness on any of their pronouncements.
sentences.chinese: 他们任何声明都是可信度为零，真实记录为零。

sentences.english: Moreover, is introduced the study of incompatibility decision-making list, concluding the rule digging process is high credibility.
sentences.chinese: 给出了具有较高可信度的规则挖掘过程。

sentences.english: Rimal stresses the importance of “source credibility”.
sentences.chinese: Rimal强调了“来源可信度”的重要性。

definition: mere verbal statement cannot be taken as proof (idiom)
conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
